title: @Riot Any chance the Jayce weapon bug has left "trivial" hell?
body: You know, the bug where his weapon has no animations at all for more than a year. Last I heard was that its too "trivial" to fix, but considering it also affects some of his skins which are paid products i would have hoped more priority goes into fixing this especially since other visual skin bugs get fixed all the time as well.

replies.body:
Hey beany, 

I know we've had this convo before, and wanted to reply here as well. We're still standing by the decision that this is trivial, and not something the team is planning to resolve. We had a discussion around this bug when you'd initially posted it, and the team hasn't changed its mind on the issue since your initial report.

How the fuck does this hamper someone's ability to play Jayce?

But it's not affecting people's ability to play the champion. The bug is just an animation not showing for his weapon changing, a ~.2 second animation isn't occurring, the weapon positioning still changes. The bug isn't as dramatic and big as you guys' are making it seem. Sure it would be nice if it got fixed, but it's still trivial and not inhibiting players.
except for the fact that the bug is causing a slight delay between when you attack and when the attack actually fires from the cannon

Wrong bug.

This is the bug:
https://gfycat.com/QualifiedRealKagu

Nothing functional, just visual. The sides of the gun don't move slightly when you auto attack.

That's it.

Not that there aren't other Jayce bugs, but this is the one that Riot's statement responds to.

Well it hasn't stopped them doing it in the past, but hey Jayce isn't cool enough for people to spend money on him so we aren't gonna fix him. Lets look at patch 6.14 bugfixes 
-Removed a few seam lines on Muay Thai Lee Sin’s model at Very Low settings
-Headless Hecarim’s smoke effects no longer stutter
-Fixed a texture issue on the top of Fnatic Gragas’s barrel Summoner’s Cup
-Fixed a stretching issue with Pool Party Lulu’s hat during her death animation
-Championship Shyvana’s teeth in dragon form are no longer super elastic when she roars

Now all of these were visual and didn't affect gameplay and theres countless of examples over 6 years, but this one example isn't worth the time? No get out, someone highlighted a bug in their game for free because they want whats best for the champion. So Rito should say "thank you for highlighting it and for still playing our game after we ignored you" and then go fix it after basically flat out telling him "we don't care about you, your opinion is TRIVIAL".
Those are all texture/particle bugs. They are infinitely easier to fix.

Oh I just picked examples from the last patch, this specific problem is his Cannon animation (but he a lot of other bugs , one that freezes the game). I mean remember patch 6.11 when they threw us this
-TAIL WHIP Ahri’s tails now move realistically on her base and all skins!
Yaaay her tail animation works better, well I want Jayce's Cannon animation to work too. How is fixing her tail (on all skins) important but Jayce's entire use of his Cannon not functioning is "trivial".

Ahri's tail wasn't a "fix", when they created the movement code for Aurelion Sol's tail they added it to a few champions. That's a much easier job than finding a bug and fixing it, which can take quite a while, especially if they decide the bug isn't hurting anything.
It's a broken part of their game, it should be fixed. End of story. That's how development of a massive game works (or should work in this case), you fix your bugs.
Which they are doing. Only not in the insanely inefficient order OP wants them to.

They don't have an infinite number of people working on the game to debug it, they have to decide and prioritize bugs based off impact. And this one has the smallest impact imaginable, calling it a bug is misleading and saying its a trivial bug is almost quite frankly too generous.
